description.narrative:
Oxfam Novib improves the realisation of youth#s sexual and reproductive health and rights including HIV/Aids in the Southern Africaregion. The social change we want our programme to achieve is: Youth, particularly young women and girls, young LGBTI and young female sex workers in Mozambique and Zimbabwe have an improved ability to claim and exercise their SRHR in an environment which is morerespectful of their rights and more responsive to their needs.
To achieve this, we have developed a comprehensive Theory of Change(ToC) comprising five mutually reinforcing pathways, with interventions at community, national and regional level (focusing on SADC).
1. CIVIL SOCIETY CAPACITY. CSOs and networks are respected as (1) legitimate representatives of youth and (2) have the ability to influence access to sexual and reproductive health (SRH) services as well as laws, policies and practices at community, country and regional levels.
2. AGENCY. Youth have an improved ability to make informed and responsible decisions about their own SRHR and have a voice in society and policy-making at community, country and regional levels.
3. ACCESS. The access of youth to quality comprehensive SRH health services which are respectful of their rights and responsiveto their needs has improved.
4. LEGAL AND POLICY FRAMEWORK. Laws, policies and practices at community, country and regional levels have been adopted, improved, budgeted for and/ or implemented to ensure that youth can exercise their SRHR.
5. PUBLICAWARENESS. Increased public awareness of the sexual and reproductive rights of youth.
Our target group is youth aged 10-35, combining the definition of youth in the African Youth Charter with the United Nations (UN) definition of adolescents. We will especially focus on: 1. young women and girls; 2. young Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender and Intersex (LGBTI) and young female sex workers.
These choices are based on a joint context and gender analysis andexperience working with them.
Sincewehave established good experience, strong local partners and civil society networks with LGBTIin Mozambique and Zimbabwe, we will continue and strengthen this work in these countries. Together with our country teams in Mozambique and Zimbabwe, we arecurrently further developing the details of the project that will be financed with SAN funds, falling within the broader framework as described above.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services

legacy-data.value: Say YES! Youth Empowerment on SRHR
